title: ba space
summary: In mathematics, the ba space b a ( Σ ) {\displaystyle ba(\Sigma )} of an algebra of sets Σ {\displaystyle \Sigma } is the Banach space consisting of all bounded and finitely additive signed measures on Σ {\displaystyle \Sigma } . The norm is defined as the variation, that is ‖ ν ‖ = | ν | ( X ) . {\displaystyle \|\nu \|=|\nu |(X).} [1]
